description: Leverage third party claims data and/or new price transparency data in comparison of client’s IP/OP rates by procedure, service line, and macro-service line to market.

fields.Description:
- Unique system-generated ID for each patient 
- Patient ID must not include any elements that can be traced back to the patient, including patient SSN, member ID, zip code, date of service
- SHA2 algorithm is recommended for encryption

- Unique system-generated ID for each unique combination of member ID, admission date, and discharge date
- Case ID must not include any elements (e.g., alphanumeric values) that can be traced back to patient or visit-specific factors, including patient SSN, member ID, zip code, admission date, discharge date
- SHA2 algorithm is recommended for encryption
- Encrypted service month, date, and year in chronological order; convert dates to integer sequence, e.g. ‘06/27/2016’ and ‘06/28/2016’ can be converted to 1001 and 1002 to avoid PHI/PII
Facility name
- Procedure code, as defined as a CPT or HCPC, but soft coded
- 4-digit numbers that are used on hospital bills to tell the insurance companies either where the patient was when they received treatment
- The number of units billed for each procedure code
E.g., total charge associated with each service code
E.g., negotatied allowed amount
Calendar year of the discharge, e.g. 2019
Prioritized MSA
Inpatient / Outpatient
Institutional / Professional
Primary payor name, e.g., Aetna, Cigna, BCBS, Humana, United
Specification of plan type, e.g., Commercial, Medicare FFS
Billing facility (If applicable, please provide name that corresponds to the CMS provider number)
Diagnosis-related group number (1-999) with no leading zeros (e.g., 001 should be 1)
Total charges associated with payor and facility during specified year
Total expected payment by the payor for the specified procedure and line of business, institutional fee only
Total actual payment by the payor for the specified procedure and line of business, institutional fee only
Total number of unique combinations between patient ID and admission/visit date for a full year, institutional or professional fee
Procedure code, as defined as a CPT or HCPC

description:
Required for: Payor Yield, Patient Yield, and Revenue Integrity assessment categories

Financial values summarized at the individual transaction level (i.e. multiple transactions may occur for a given patient encounter).  This includes aspects and description (i.e. timing) of patient and payor payments, and characteristics of patient including coverage type.

description:
Required for: Operating Model assessment category

In-house costs for both labor and non-labor expenditures that are incurred by the provider's revenue cycle in an effort to obtain payment rendered for services (i.e. a revenue cycle employee's salary).

fields.Description: Unique employee identifier
Employee full name
ID of Clinic
Name of Clinic
Location of facility
Flag to denote if the employee is currently active or not

Flag to identify if the employee is contractor or not
Flag to denote if employee is part of a Union or not

Flag to denote if employee receives benefits or not
Total years of experience for the employee at the time of hiring. Zero if new grad
Medical & 401K
Indirect cost
Area of RCM (i.e. Billing)

The specific team an employee is part of. For example, if an employee is part of the coding department, they could be embedded in the "OP radiology coding" team.

The employees staffing heirarchy may be "Finance>revenue cycle>Coding>OP radiology coding team
Indicator that describes if an employee is working from home, hybrid, or fully in-office
